mdRecord.dcterms:title: Egyptian Revival Gateway, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bigelow, Jacob (American doctor, botanist, architect, 1786-1879) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In 1832, one year after its founding, Mount Auburn built its first structure, the Egyptian Revival Gateway. Designed by one of the Cemetery’s founders, Dr. Jacob Bigelow, the Gateway was constructed of wood that was painted gray and dusted with sand when it was still wet so as to give the appearance of granite…. ten years later, in 1842, it was rebuilt of Quincy granite by Octavius T. Rogers. -- https://mountauburn.org/egyptian-revival-gate/ [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
